ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 76
ygData.msgSnippet: Couple of questions: 1. when i make cams what do i do with them, sell them, who puts it on the bows? 2. have you guys heard of a clockwork gnome called
ygData.messageBody:
Couple of questions:
1. when i make cams what do i do with them, sell them, who puts it on the
bows?
2. have you guys heard of a clockwork gnome called Gearhead in lesser
faydark? anyway i had a friend kill him and he was carrying a black box XIVd
?
any clue what it is , it is a lore item.
what about using hinges on the pole?
pole, hinge, gears, metal twine?
i have not tried it yet but will tomorrow.


>From: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
>Reply-To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
>To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 76
>Date: 8 Sep 1999 07:00:51 -0000
>

>Message: 1
> Date: Tue, 7 Sep 1999 01:20:11 -0400
> From: "dlobdell" <dlobdell@...>
>Subject: Re: Listen, here. Listen well.
>
>And I quote:
>
>"Thats what they did, and they found something, so why shouldn't you have
>to do the same thing that they did? Why should you just sit back and
>happily profit from
>all thier work?"
>If these are his true feelings, then wouldn't it be "common sense" to assum
>that he himself should have also worked towards this "secret"... the old
>fashion way.. yet instead, from the way he has worded it, and I understand,
>he has (if there is any truth to this at all) conned this information out
>of this "Secret group". If you look beyond his flavored use of words and
>meaningless advice, he is no better... nothing more... then us, the people
>who instead of researching ourselves want the information handed to us...
>although we attempt some form of detective work, it is mainly the view of a
>bat... we look around blindly for the answer, however we still, deep down
>expect the answer to be handed to us through sound (word of mouth). My
>point is, if this was something that people wanted to keep secret, they
>would not let it leak to ppl such as "Joshua Bednarz" who brag about this
>so called knowledge on the Tinkering list itself... because this, this is
>how stuff gets leaked.. one person says something, which leads to someone
>else gaining the knowledge, and the never ending catalyist begins. So thank
>you Joshua, thank you for pushing over the first domino... now the fun
>begins!
>
>Wes Lobdell,
>Note: I'm not a Mac person, but you have to admit, the following is funny!!
>:) And if you don't "get" it, then I guess the media hasn't soaked it for
>all its worth yet after all...
>Quote: "Macintosh -- we might not get everything right, but
>atleast we knew the century was going to end."
>
>------------------------
>My all time favorite Oxymorons:
>exact estimate, plastic silverware, genuine imitation, mud bath, original
>copy, student teacher, alone together, anarchy rules, bitter sweet,
>bankrupt millionaire, black light, butt-head, casual sex, clean dirt, coed
>sorority, cold as hell, computer jock, constant change, cowardly lion,
>curved line(according to the mathematical definition of a line),
>delibrate mistake, dry wine, earth angel(ok thats just going back a ways
>;), educational television, even odds, found missing, freezer burn, fresh
>cheese, full-length bikini, half full, half naked, hard water, hells
>angels, idiot savant, jumbo shrimp, less is more, and finally my all time
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Joshua Bednarz <thewhitemage@...>
>To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
>Date: Tuesday, September 07, 1999 12:09 AM
>Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Listen, here. Listen well.
>
>
> >From: "Joshua Bednarz" <thewhitemage@...>
> >
> >I do know something. I took all my knowledge, everything I know, used all
> >the common sense I have, and was able to talk my way into a clue from a
> >person that knows all about the fishing poles. At first I thought whoever
> >knew about it was selfish, that they had no right to keep this, but then
> >when I found out that this group of people worked hard for what they had
> >found, and are very secrective about it, don't deserve their secret to be
> >given away. I mean, THEY are the ones that found the secret, and yes it
>is a
> >secret, so why is it that they should just go off and tell everyone? This
> >game is all about exploration and finding things, and having fun. Thats
>what
> >they did, and they found something, so why shouldn't you have to do the
>same
> >thing that they did? Why should you just sit back and happily profit from
> >all thier work? This group, whom is a very secretive group, whom I shall
>not
> >name, worked hard to get what they know, and so I'm not going to go
>giving
> >away the clue I was told, especially after the rude, immature, derogatory
> >comments that were made about me. I will tell you this though. Waste not
>a
> >plat more on trying combinations. You are not only wasting your money,
>but
> >you are wasting your time. Search the world, high and low, search the
>world
> >above and below...
> >This is all I will say. It's been nice being part of this list. I though
>you
> >were a bunch of decent people. Your coments have changed my mind. I will
>no
> >longer be a part of this list as you wish. It's been fun guys, and thanks
> >for all the fish.
> >
> >Sniffledoo Copperheart 18th Common Squire of The Scarlet Blade
> >

>See ya.. take your secrets with you... you don't know anything and I'm glad
>to see one more troll gone. Signing up to a site dedicated to sharing
>information then posting some kind of, "I know but I won't share" message
>in the hopes that everyone will beg you for info was immature to begin

>original post.

>Message: 9
> Date: Tue, 7 Sep 1999 17:25:41 -0400
> From: "Russ Gresh" <lordgrunk@...>
>Subject: third tinkering book
>
>while I agree that Josh is an ass I think he's right, we should stop
>wasting time trying to guess the formula and work on finding the third book
>(which is actually the first). even if someone does guess the fishing pole
>there are still other things in the book that we don't know, like
>fireworks. I know this book exists and to prove it I'll give you the one
>formula I was able to get out of the person who has it. animated bait -- 1
>cork, 1 spricket. the only purpose I can find for this is practice for non
>gnomes since the two things cost much more than bait and it's trivial for a
>gnome. personally I think the book is in Solusek's eye, the tinkering
>merchant has to be there for some reason. I just hope we don't have to kill
>a gnome for it.
>
>Fixer gnomish enchanter
>
>
>
>_______________________________________________________________________________
>_______________________________________________________________________________
